dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't think of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Zed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come.  Sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kitchen is an absolute pig stye.  Dishes are piled up the sink and on the counter. Oliver grabs a glass that has some old beer in it and emp it.  He scratches some filth off of it and pours some bee into the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zed takes a seat on the couch next to Claude. Suddenly, a SPIDER MONKEY dressed in a little Uncle Sam  costume comes screeching up onto Zed's lap and then up on his head, the whole time clawing at his eyes. Eric, amused, turns from the men playing cards and smiles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Zed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy.  Don't scare him.  He just wants to  claim you. Zed is frozen as the monkey climbs around him and then on Claude's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me introduce you properly.  This is  Enrique. The monkey screeches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He likes to be called Chim Chim, but we  don't always get what we like...do we? Again, the hideous creature screeches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Enrique)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tais-toi! (then to Zed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like hash? Then Eric interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jokingly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't sit next to that junkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhhhh! Claude throws a lit cigarette at him which explodes into mass of sparks.  They laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Claude)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That little shit monkey of yours pissed  on my Billy Holiday albums.  Next time  he's out the door. (to Zed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zed, come here. Zed gets up and goes with Eric to the bedroom.  On the wa Oliver hands him the glass of beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go mate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Oliver sits down next to Claude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric's bed has probably never been made.  In fact, this r looks a lot like Quentin Tarantino's old apartment.  But, there is a certain order to all this chaos.  Eric pulls o blueprint and spreads it out over the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ask me where we got this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Bastille Day, all the banks are  closed. He places his hand on the blueprint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this one.  BIP.  The Banque  Internationale de Paris.  And for being  greedy capitalists perhaps they will  remain closed next Bastille day.  Yes? Zed smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will go in and shut the bank down.   Now, look at this. Eric pulls out a complex electronic schematic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you can see, only one person can start  the alarm. (he hands it to Zed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The concierge, at this desk. (he points it out on the  blueprint)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will take care of him.  Then we can  close the bank.  No one will know the  difference since every other bank will be  closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning the schematic around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure he won't push the alarm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh!  He's right next to the door.  We'd  have to be totally incompetent not to  stop him.  Don't worry about that. He points to the main floor vault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.  This is where they keep the days  reserve cash.  Okay fuck that. He flips the page to the lower level blueprint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are many vaults downstairs, but  this is the vault we must get into.  This  is where the real prize is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of vault is that? He checks the blueprint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah...Swiss made.  A Caliber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caliber? (he thinks about it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll take three hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's too long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how long it'll take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well shit.  It's too long.  We have to be  in and out. (he snaps his fingers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like that.  Or there will be suspicion.   A little time is okay...but too long  and... He shrugs his shoulders in an "I don't know gesture."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well hold on a second. (pointing to the blueprint)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this? Eric looks down at the blueprint.  There is a small passa connecting the main vault to an adjacent vault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another vault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No this. Eric looks closely at the blueprint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...it connects the two  vaults.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what kind of vault is this other  one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading the blueprint)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Also Swiss, but this one is a Poseidon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would those two vaults be connected?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I can get into this vault in half  an hour.  Maybe less.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this entry way is too small to get  the platen out.  We have a lot of  merchandise in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, don't you see?  We get in through  this secondary vault and take this  passage to the other main vault.  From  the inside I could open the Caliber vault  in five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could open it in five minutes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the inside it's easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot damn.  That is our answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  When is Bastille day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow!?  We're doing this tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not impossible.  Everyone knows what  to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need to know shit.  Just get  into the vault and we'll do the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't even seen the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck the bank.  Before we do a job we  live life.  It's better that way.  Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unsure)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  Now we do heroin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXTREME CLOSE ON:  Eric making heroin. The heroin powder is put into a spoon with some lemon  squeezed into it, then a little bit of tap water.  Huddle around Eric are Francois, Ricardo, and Oliver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (so high he's wobbling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to look at the Starship  Enterprise as a metaphor for the human  brain. No one is really listening to Oliver.  Eric takes out a  lighter and cooks it to a boil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock is the right hemisphere of the  brain, all logic and intellect. Mc Coy is  the left hemisphere, stricktly emotional.   And Kirk is the unseen observer.  He  drifts between the two.  Back and forth,  as it might be, caught between the two  thought processes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Cotton.] Ricardo hands him a cotton ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really quite brilliant you know.   That's why Star Trek is and always will  be a hit show. Eric places the cotton ball in the spoon with the mixture

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Oliver)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Here, shut up and hold this.] He hands Oliver the spoon and takes out a needle.  Using cotton as a filter he draws the heroin into the syringe. Then, he holds the syringe up and starts tapping it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Don't want to get air bubbles in my  veins.] They all laugh at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the meantime, Zed is sitting on the couch with Claude Jean.  Claude is rolling a hash and tobacco cigarette.  J is chopping up some powder heroin on the glass of a small picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want heroin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I want to be sharp for tomorrow. Jean and Claude laugh at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  A little bit of heroin, some hash, a  beer...and you're just right. Jean snorts a line. Claude offers Zed the spliff.  Zed shakes his head "no".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recovering from the snort)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good. Eric, Francois, Ricardo, and Oliver come out of the kitch laughing. Eric, Ricardo, and Oliver take a seat on the couch opposi Zed.  Francois sits on the floor. Eric rolls up his sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ricardo in French)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Hold my arm.] (then to Zed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My vein is like a rock. Ricardo takes hold of his arm and squeezes.  Eric inserts needle into his vein and draws out a little blood.  It mi with the heroin, then he pumps it in...then back into the syringe, then all the way back in. He withdraws the needle. Ricardo lets go of his arm. Eric is in bliss.  His eyes roll back into his head.  He  looks like he's on the verge of falling asleep. Then Jean takes another snort. Pretty soon everyone is smoking and getting high, shootin up, and drinking more beer. Then Jean holds out a piece of folded aluminum foil with heroin in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Zed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try some.  It's called chasing the  dragon.  The Chinese have been doing it  for centuries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, but you must.  It will make you feel  as though the rest of the world is in a  bubble of glass and that you're rubbing  up against it like a bad windshield  wiper. They stick the aluminum foil with the heroin in it up nex his face.  They then light the bottom of the foil with a  lighter.  Before Zed knows it, he's inhaling a silky ribb of smoke. Suddenly our plane of focus wildly shifts and we...

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Ricardo is racing Eric's car through the streets of Paris weaving in and out of traffic.  Next to him is Oliver, an the back seat is Zed and Eric.  They're giving the very  stoned Zed a whirlwind tour of the sights. A car speeds up next to them.  In it is Francois, and Cla with Jean driving.  They are racing with Ricardo through streets. The Patrick Hernandez song "Born To Be Alive" is blasting away on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There.  That's Notre Dame. But before Zed can even look it has past by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like French cars? All Zed can notice is that the speedometer is at 160  kilometers per hour.  He tries to calculate what that is miles per hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (answering Enrique's question)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like the Cadillac.  Fifty-two to  seventy-five.  Very nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up here you can see the Eiffel tower. Zed is in too much of a blur.  He leans over to Eric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is tomorrow really Bastille day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, tomorrow we pull the biggest job in  French history.  And spend the rest of  our lives in Monte Carlo. The drunken Englishman, Oliver, belches and then cheers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two cars are franticly racing through traffic.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Jean is very intent on beating them to whatever location is they're going to. Claude, in the seat next to him, gives him some advice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Faster, faster...go faster.  Let's beat  them!] Francois laughs and coughs out a cloud of smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean's car makes a dangerous lane change across traffic a cuts off Ricardo.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Ricardo swerves as he passes a joint to Eric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Shit!  That bastard.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ricardo)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch it!  Don't crash my car. Eric takes a big hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over here is where the male prostitutes  sell themselves.  Do you see? No, Zed doesn't see. Suddenly, everyone in the car is shouting out the windows

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out the window)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking fags!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (also out the window)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suce ma bite?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perverts d'homosexuels! Eric laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into Zed's ear)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is good to have you here.  We could  not do this without you. Zed nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone has agreed to give you double  shares.  That's good. Zed nods, delirious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I have AIDS.  From the needle. Zed can't believe this.  He's not sure if what he heard w what he thought he heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Then Eric sees something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, up here is the Arc de Triomphe. They take a sharp turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric, Zed, Francois, Ricardo, Jean, Claude, and Oliver ar all walking down some dank stone steps into a cellar.   Somewhere crazy Raymond Scott Toy Jazz music is playing. An old wine cellar has been converted into a Toy Jazz clu Nothing fancy...dirt floors, chairs and small tables  scattered about...but the arched brick ceilings make for  great acoustics.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: a BAND is playing away.  In the audience sit about TWELVE FRENCH PEOPLE, all enjoying the music.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BUFFET
dialogues.text: In the back of the club near the doors some tables have b set up with a buffet of local cuisine on it.  Behind the  tables are two rotund but happy French women MIRELLE and  JOSEPHINE. Eric, Zed, Francois, Ricardo, Jean, Claude, and Oliver wa in and immediately start blabbing away in French to Mirel and Josephine. Eric hands them some money.

dialogues.speaker: ZED'S TABLE
dialogues.text: Everyone enters and takes seats at various parts of the c Oliver sits next to Zed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, how long have you known Eric?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Eric's mother is American.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and his dad's French.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're divorced.  And she and his father  had some kind of six month split plan set  up.  So every six months he would come  back to the states.  We were best  friends.  Eventually he and his mother  had a falling out and he stayed here.   It's been...years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's good to have you here.  Eric  speaks fairly highly of you.  Say, he  says you're a big fan of Viking films.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...I suppose.  I used to be, when I  was young.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh they're the best.  Helmets with horns  on them.  Shit.  That's fucking genius. He starts laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout Toy Jazz?  You like it? Zed watches the players on stage and then nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love it.  It's really good, you know?   Like real music.  It has a heart and  culture all it's own.  It's, like, jazz  for dwarves...or guys in Leiderhosen.   Total purity of essence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hungry cannibals'd like it. Then Claude comes up to them with some glasses and a bott of red wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, you must drink some of this wine,  it's good. He pours Zed a glass. Oliver passes on the wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Claude)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Non merci, c'est de la merde.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Oliver)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: La ferme.  C'est du bon vin. (to Zed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fucking English. Zed sips some.  He's in no real shape to tell if the wine good or not.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: Suddenly, it seems as though the bands music gets louder. The horns really start to scream and the room becomes a  delirium of music. The band stands up.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: The people watching start to dance, if not in their seats then right in front of everything.

dialogues.speaker: ZED'S TABLE
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Zed notices something...

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: Eric is up on stage playing a trombone right alongside th band.

dialogues.speaker: ZED'S TABLE
dialogues.text: Zed blinks but it's true. Oliver and Claude start laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at him.  He's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: And surely he must be, yet, in a strange way, he's keepin with the other musicians and sounding pretty good. Eric is all smile as he plays with them.  Sweat is runnin down his face but he's caught up in the moment. ELISE, a woman from the audience has jumped up onto the  stage, caught up in Eric's frenzy, and is dancing about l James Brown. Then, the music crescendos and Eric hands the trombone ba to a musician. The set is over. Eric skips off the stage and walks over to where Oliver,  Claude, and Zed are sitting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The McDonalds on the corner of Boulevard Saint Michel and Soufflot is bustling. Eric's Citroen screeches around the corner on it's way pa the Pantheon and into the heart of the fifth Arrondissmen

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Eric and Zed are driving through the streets of Paris in  Eric's car.  The grooving Ryuichi Sakamoto song "Triste" playing on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you came.  How long has it been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's amazing, you know?  Here you are.   One day in America.  Now here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, to be honest there really wasn't  much happening for me in the states.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But in Paris your old friend Eric has a  job for you, so you came.  That's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could I resist your invitation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would have been stupid to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what have you been doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After school I spent some time in Algeria  studying African philosophy.  And then I  bummed around.  You know.  For fun.  For  a while I worked at Le Figaro.  The  newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  With an assumed Masters degree.   And lately we have just been bombing  fascists here in Paris.  You know, like  terrorists. Zed looks over at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric and Zed walk up the stairs to the fifth floor where  Eric's flat is.  On the top landing there is a dead cat  laying.  Zed and Eric notice the cat as Eric is opening t door. There is also a telephone coming out of the neighbors doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The people next door are on holiday.  We  took their phone.  If you want to make a  long distance call, go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that cat dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  I think it's asleep but  it's been there for days. Eric gives it a kick.  No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess it is dead. They walk into the flat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric's flat consists of a good sized living room area wit connected kitchen and a small bedroom in the back.  In th front of the living room there is a small balcony where t sounds of the city pour in.  The room itself is a general mess.  A bunch of guns are piled in one corner of the flo Hung up on the wall is a huge, French "Dressed To Kill"  poster. Some Brazilian Gilberto/Getz music is playing. Sitting at the table playing cards are three men:  FRANCO RICARDO, and JEAN. Sitting on the couch rolling a cigarette with hash is CLA and OLIVER. They all turn as Zed and Eric walk in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. They all return the greeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Zed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  This is Francois, Ricardo, Jean,  Oliver, and Claude.  Got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all know who you are. (to the rest of them)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ne soyez pa salauds.  Offrez une biere au  plus grand perceur de coffres. Oliver stands up and walks to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with an English accent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zed, would you like a beer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't think of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Zed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come.  Sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kitchen is an absolute pig stye.  Dishes are piled up the sink and on the counter. Oliver grabs a glass that has some old beer in it and emp it.  He scratches some filth off of it and pours some bee into the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zed takes a seat on the couch next to Claude. Suddenly, a SPIDER MONKEY dressed in a little Uncle Sam  costume comes screeching up onto Zed's lap and then up on his head, the whole time clawing at his eyes. Eric, amused, turns from the men playing cards and smiles

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Zed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy.  Don't scare him.  He just wants to  claim you. Zed is frozen as the monkey climbs around him and then on Claude's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me introduce you properly.  This is  Enrique. The monkey screeches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He likes to be called Chim Chim, but we  don't always get what we like...do we? Again, the hideous creature screeches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Enrique)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tais-toi! (then to Zed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like hash? Then Eric interrupts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jokingly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't sit next to that junkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhhhh! Claude throws a lit cigarette at him which explodes into mass of sparks.  They laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Claude)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That little shit monkey of yours pissed  on my Billy Holiday albums.  Next time  he's out the door. (to Zed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zed, come here. Zed gets up and goes with Eric to the bedroom.  On the wa Oliver hands him the glass of beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go mate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Oliver sits down next to Claude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric's bed has probably never been made.  In fact, this r looks a lot like Quentin Tarantino's old apartment.  But, there is a certain order to all this chaos.  Eric pulls o blueprint and spreads it out over the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ask me where we got this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Bastille Day, all the banks are  closed. He places his hand on the blueprint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this one.  BIP.  The Banque  Internationale de Paris.  And for being  greedy capitalists perhaps they will  remain closed next Bastille day.  Yes? Zed smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will go in and shut the bank down.   Now, look at this. Eric pulls out a complex electronic schematic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you can see, only one person can start  the alarm. (he hands it to Zed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The concierge, at this desk. (he points it out on the  blueprint)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will take care of him.  Then we can  close the bank.  No one will know the  difference since every other bank will be  closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning the schematic around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure he won't push the alarm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh!  He's right next to the door.  We'd  have to be totally incompetent not to  stop him.  Don't worry about that. He points to the main floor vault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.  This is where they keep the days  reserve cash.  Okay fuck that. He flips the page to the lower level blueprint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are many vaults downstairs, but  this is the vault we must get into.  This  is where the real prize is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of vault is that? He checks the blueprint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah...Swiss made.  A Caliber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caliber? (he thinks about it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll take three hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's too long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how long it'll take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well shit.  It's too long.  We have to be  in and out. (he snaps his fingers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like that.  Or there will be suspicion.   A little time is okay...but too long  and... He shrugs his shoulders in an "I don't know gesture."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well hold on a second. (pointing to the blueprint)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this? Eric looks down at the blueprint.  There is a small passa connecting the main vault to an adjacent vault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another vault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No this. Eric looks closely at the blueprint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...it connects the two  vaults.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what kind of vault is this other  one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading the blueprint)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Also Swiss, but this one is a Poseidon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would those two vaults be connected?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I can get into this vault in half  an hour.  Maybe less.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this entry way is too small to get  the platen out.  We have a lot of  merchandise in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, don't you see?  We get in through  this secondary vault and take this  passage to the other main vault.  From  the inside I could open the Caliber vault  in five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could open it in five minutes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the inside it's easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot damn.  That is our answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  When is Bastille day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow!?  We're doing this tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not impossible.  Everyone knows what  to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need to know shit.  Just get  into the vault and we'll do the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't even seen the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck the bank.  Before we do a job we  live life.  It's better that way.  Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unsure)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  Now we do heroin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXTREME CLOSE ON:  Eric making heroin. The heroin powder is put into a spoon with some lemon  squeezed into it, then a little bit of tap water.  Huddle around Eric are Francois, Ricardo, and Oliver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (so high he's wobbling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to look at the Starship  Enterprise as a metaphor for the human  brain. No one is really listening to Oliver.  Eric takes out a  lighter and cooks it to a boil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock is the right hemisphere of the  brain, all logic and intellect. Mc Coy is  the left hemisphere, stricktly emotional.   And Kirk is the unseen observer.  He  drifts between the two.  Back and forth,  as it might be, caught between the two  thought processes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Cotton.] Ricardo hands him a cotton ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really quite brilliant you know.   That's why Star Trek is and always will  be a hit show. Eric places the cotton ball in the spoon with the mixture

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Oliver)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Here, shut up and hold this.] He hands Oliver the spoon and takes out a needle.  Using cotton as a filter he draws the heroin into the syringe. Then, he holds the syringe up and starts tapping it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Don't want to get air bubbles in my  veins.] They all laugh at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the meantime, Zed is sitting on the couch with Claude Jean.  Claude is rolling a hash and tobacco cigarette.  J is chopping up some powder heroin on the glass of a small picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want heroin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I want to be sharp for tomorrow. Jean and Claude laugh at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  A little bit of heroin, some hash, a  beer...and you're just right. Jean snorts a line. Claude offers Zed the spliff.  Zed shakes his head "no".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recovering from the snort)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good. Eric, Francois, Ricardo, and Oliver come out of the kitch laughing. Eric, Ricardo, and Oliver take a seat on the couch opposi Zed.  Francois sits on the floor. Eric rolls up his sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ricardo in French)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Hold my arm.] (then to Zed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My vein is like a rock. Ricardo takes hold of his arm and squeezes.  Eric inserts needle into his vein and draws out a little blood.  It mi with the heroin, then he pumps it in...then back into the syringe, then all the way back in. He withdraws the needle. Ricardo lets go of his arm. Eric is in bliss.  His eyes roll back into his head.  He  looks like he's on the verge of falling asleep. Then Jean takes another snort. Pretty soon everyone is smoking and getting high, shootin up, and drinking more beer. Then Jean holds out a piece of folded aluminum foil with heroin in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Zed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try some.  It's called chasing the  dragon.  The Chinese have been doing it  for centuries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, but you must.  It will make you feel  as though the rest of the world is in a  bubble of glass and that you're rubbing  up against it like a bad windshield  wiper. They stick the aluminum foil with the heroin in it up nex his face.  They then light the bottom of the foil with a  lighter.  Before Zed knows it, he's inhaling a silky ribb of smoke. Suddenly our plane of focus wildly shifts and we...

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Ricardo is racing Eric's car through the streets of Paris weaving in and out of traffic.  Next to him is Oliver, an the back seat is Zed and Eric.  They're giving the very  stoned Zed a whirlwind tour of the sights. A car speeds up next to them.  In it is Francois, and Cla with Jean driving.  They are racing with Ricardo through streets. The Patrick Hernandez song "Born To Be Alive" is blasting away on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There.  That's Notre Dame. But before Zed can even look it has past by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like French cars? All Zed can notice is that the speedometer is at 160  kilometers per hour.  He tries to calculate what that is miles per hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (answering Enrique's question)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like the Cadillac.  Fifty-two to  seventy-five.  Very nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up here you can see the Eiffel tower. Zed is in too much of a blur.  He leans over to Eric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is tomorrow really Bastille day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, tomorrow we pull the biggest job in  French history.  And spend the rest of  our lives in Monte Carlo. The drunken Englishman, Oliver, belches and then cheers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two cars are franticly racing through traffic.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Jean is very intent on beating them to whatever location is they're going to. Claude, in the seat next to him, gives him some advice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Faster, faster...go faster.  Let's beat  them!] Francois laughs and coughs out a cloud of smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jean's car makes a dangerous lane change across traffic a cuts off Ricardo.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Ricardo swerves as he passes a joint to Eric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Shit!  That bastard.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ricardo)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch it!  Don't crash my car. Eric takes a big hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over here is where the male prostitutes  sell themselves.  Do you see? No, Zed doesn't see. Suddenly, everyone in the car is shouting out the windows

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out the window)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking fags!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (also out the window)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suce ma bite?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perverts d'homosexuels! Eric laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into Zed's ear)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is good to have you here.  We could  not do this without you. Zed nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone has agreed to give you double  shares.  That's good. Zed nods, delirious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I have AIDS.  From the needle. Zed can't believe this.  He's not sure if what he heard w what he thought he heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Then Eric sees something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, up here is the Arc de Triomphe. They take a sharp turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric, Zed, Francois, Ricardo, Jean, Claude, and Oliver ar all walking down some dank stone steps into a cellar.   Somewhere crazy Raymond Scott Toy Jazz music is playing. An old wine cellar has been converted into a Toy Jazz clu Nothing fancy...dirt floors, chairs and small tables  scattered about...but the arched brick ceilings make for  great acoustics.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: a BAND is playing away.  In the audience sit about TWELVE FRENCH PEOPLE, all enjoying the music.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BUFFET
dialogues.text: In the back of the club near the doors some tables have b set up with a buffet of local cuisine on it.  Behind the  tables are two rotund but happy French women MIRELLE and  JOSEPHINE. Eric, Zed, Francois, Ricardo, Jean, Claude, and Oliver wa in and immediately start blabbing away in French to Mirel and Josephine. Eric hands them some money.

dialogues.speaker: ZED'S TABLE
dialogues.text: Everyone enters and takes seats at various parts of the c Oliver sits next to Zed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, how long have you known Eric?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Eric's mother is American.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and his dad's French.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're divorced.  And she and his father  had some kind of six month split plan set  up.  So every six months he would come  back to the states.  We were best  friends.  Eventually he and his mother  had a falling out and he stayed here.   It's been...years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's good to have you here.  Eric  speaks fairly highly of you.  Say, he  says you're a big fan of Viking films.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...I suppose.  I used to be, when I  was young.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh they're the best.  Helmets with horns  on them.  Shit.  That's fucking genius. He starts laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout Toy Jazz?  You like it? Zed watches the players on stage and then nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love it.  It's really good, you know?   Like real music.  It has a heart and  culture all it's own.  It's, like, jazz  for dwarves...or guys in Leiderhosen.   Total purity of essence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hungry cannibals'd like it. Then Claude comes up to them with some glasses and a bott of red wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, you must drink some of this wine,  it's good. He pours Zed a glass. Oliver passes on the wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Claude)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Non merci, c'est de la merde.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Oliver)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: La ferme.  C'est du bon vin. (to Zed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fucking English. Zed sips some.  He's in no real shape to tell if the wine good or not.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: Suddenly, it seems as though the bands music gets louder. The horns really start to scream and the room becomes a  delirium of music. The band stands up.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: The people watching start to dance, if not in their seats then right in front of everything.

dialogues.speaker: ZED'S TABLE
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Zed notices something...

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: Eric is up on stage playing a trombone right alongside th band.

dialogues.speaker: ZED'S TABLE
dialogues.text: Zed blinks but it's true. Oliver and Claude start laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at him.  He's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: And surely he must be, yet, in a strange way, he's keepin with the other musicians and sounding pretty good. Eric is all smile as he plays with them.  Sweat is runnin down his face but he's caught up in the moment. ELISE, a woman from the audience has jumped up onto the  stage, caught up in Eric's frenzy, and is dancing about l James Brown. Then, the music crescendos and Eric hands the trombone ba to a musician. The set is over. Eric skips off the stage and walks over to where Oliver,  Claude, and Zed are sitting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXTREME CLOSE ON:  The door to the bank. Francois puts a sign on the door that reads:  [Closed for Bastille Day].

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sub lobby teller and the sub lobby guard #2 rendezvou with the sub lobby assistant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to assistant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Do the phones work?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [They went dead.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merde! They walk out into the sub lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sub level teller and the sub lobby assistant walk int the sub lobby just as Eric, Zed, Oliver, and the bank man start coming down the stairs. At the sight of Eric and his men the sub lobby guard #2 a his weapon but does not fire because of the bank manager. Eric presses his Uzi against the bank manager's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the guard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Drop the gun!] He doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Drop your gun now and nobody dies!] After a moments thought about this, and the fact that Oli has a sawed-off aimed at him, he slowly puts his gun on t floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Good boy.] They descend down the stairs into the sub lobby. Oliver takes his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francois, Ricardo, and Jean have finished herding everyon behind the teller windows.  Claude is on his way downstai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [I'm going to check things out  downstairs.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the people)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Now!  On the ground!  Face down!] Then, for effect, he kicks a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claude comes downstairs with his gun raised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [All clear down here?] Everyone turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Take these two upstairs.  And chain the  gate to the sub lobby shut.] Oliver pushes the sub lobby guard #2 and the sub lobby  assistant toward Claude.  Then he hands him a chain. Claude can barely maintain his enthusiasm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [The phones and video are down!  We're  locked up tight!] (then in English)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We fucking did it! He takes the two upstairs. Eric smiles through his teeth at the bank manager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Any others I should worry about?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [No.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Oliver)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Well, just to be sure--] Then, from one of the safety deposit booths a sound is he All eyes turn to it. Oliver walks up to it and kicks the door in.  The stodgy  customer is kneeling in it.  He instantly holds his hands high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Freeze motherfucker!] Eric walks up, gun in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Who the fuck are you?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Please don't shoot me!]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [On the ground!] He does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the bank manager)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Making a deposit I hope.] (he smiles to Oliver)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Bring him with us.] They all make their way down through the sub lobby hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're herding the men through the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the sub lobby teller)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Vault locked?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Yes.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Shut your fucking mouths!]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Eric)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [The vault doors are shut and time  locked.  You won't be able to open them.] They walk through a doorway into the storage/elevator are

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric pushes the manager and the others through the doorwa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the bank manager)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [You think we're fucking amateurs?  You  think we're stupid?  I've got news for  you...we planned ahead my friend!] Eric pushes them infront of the Calibre vault door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Now save us a lot of time and just open  the vault.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [No.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Okay.] He releases the bank manager and stuffs the barrel of his handgun into the sub level tellers mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Open the vault.] The teller's eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [I cannot.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Oh.] (to the teller)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Can you?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [No.  Once closed only I can open it.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Then open it.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [I cannot.] The sub lobby teller's eyes plead with the bank manager. Zed is watching the whole affair nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Do you understand that I'll kill her if  you don't open this fucking vault?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Do you understand that this is an  international reserve bank?  Robbing it  is punishable by life imprisonment.] Eric fires.  The back of the sub lobby teller's head pain the wall red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus fucking Christ! The bank manager, shocked as he is, looks at Zed.  He kno he's an American. The sub lobby teller's body slumps to the ground. Eric grabs the stodgy customer and puts the gun to his  temple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Open the vault door or I'll kill this  man next.] The bank manager is freaking out, but after what was prob the most horribly agonizing internal debate, he holds his ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [I still cannot open the vault.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Come on.  It's only things in there.   This man is flesh and blood.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [I will not open the vault.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric no!  I can open the vault!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up! (then to the stodgy customer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [You're a customer in this bank and this  is how they treat you.  Do you have a  family?] He nods his head "yes".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Would you like to see them again?] He nods his head again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the manager)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [This man has a family he would like to  have Bastille day dinner with tonight.   So save us some time and open the vault.] After losing about a pound of sweat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [No.] Eric quickly removes the gun from the customers temple an fires two shots into the bank manager's face. The bank manager falls against the vault door and onto th floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking idiot. (then to the stodgy customer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [You seem like a nice man.  Tonight at  dinner think about how lucky you are and  how much you love your family.] He starts nodding his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oui.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Oliver)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Take him upstairs.] Oliver takes the customer upstairs to the rest of the peo Eric rips off his mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you ever conflict with me during  work again!  Do you hear!? Zed off his clown mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't have to shoot any of them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (patronizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sorry.  I didn't realize you were  in charge now.  Nobody told me. (his temper flares)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he had opened the vault it would have  saved us a fucking hour. He charges into the reserve vault area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter and Eric walks up to a bathroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric.  It's just that we've gone from  being thieves to murderers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh fuck it doesn't matter!  Here you get  the death penalty just for robbing a  federal bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought the death penalty was abolished  in 1980?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhhh!  That's what they tell you!  But  who cares?  I need to take a piss. Eric enters the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on his way into the bathroom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you open the vault? Zed looks at the bathroom door close.  After a fuming pau he turns and walks back toward the Poseidon vault door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francois peeks through the venetian blinds of the windows the outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Looks clear.] In the meantime, behind the teller windows guarding the  people who are laying on the floor, Jean and Ricardo are the middle of a conversation.  Oliver is sitting on the  counter, having just brought the stodgy customer upstairs Also here now are the sub lobby assistant and the sub lob guard #2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [What do you mean you're not sure if the  alarm went off or not?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [I mean I'm not sure.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Well, either it did or it didn't.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [And I'm not sure.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Well, do you think it did?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [I just fucking told you, I don't know.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Take a guess.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [It didn't.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [You're sure?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [No.  It's just a guess.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Well what kind of a fucking guess is  that?  You're saying it could have.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Yes.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Well that's fucking great.  Why didn't  you just kill that asshole to begin with.   I knew I should have been the one to kill  him.  You're always so damn slow.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Shit these masks are really hot.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [I know, I've got fucking sweat stinging  my eyes.] In the meantime Zoey is on the floor, unsure of what is g on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zed opens up his steel briefcase.  Inside of it are all s of electronic gear and tools. He takes out a tape measure and some callipers and measur out a point on the vault door.  He marks the point with a piece of chalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In one of the stalls Eric is preparing a syringe.  He has just cooked the heroin and is now tapping on it to get th bubbles out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zed takes a power drill out from the briefcase and attach special diamond tipped bit.  He measures the depth he wan to drill to and then marks the bit with a yellow pencil. He places his ear to the vault and taps the spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric readies the needle and slaps his vein.  He is shakin but trying to remain as still as possible. He places the needle at the end of a track on his arm and inserts it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zed starts drilling into the point he marked with the cha on the vault door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric's eyes roll back into his head as the heroin fills h vein. He drops the needle to the floor and sits back to enjoy t rush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoey is sitting on the floor next to the other bank hosta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXTREME CLOSE ON:  Zed's drill bit.  It burrows into the  steel wall of the safe spewing out spiral shavings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoey looks at all the people sitting around her.  They're scared.  Jean, Ricardo, and Francois are talking amongst  themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in French to Ricardo)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Do you know one?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Let's see.  Okay.  An unfortunate fellow  was locked up in prison doing five to ten  for armed robbery.  All he could think of  the whole time was eating pussy.] Zoey looks up at them telling the joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [The day finally came for his release.   He walked out of the prison with a new  suit and fifty francs the officials had  given him, and made a bee-line for the  whorehouse in the nearest town.  Slamming  his fifty francs on the front desk, he  said, "I wanna eat some pussy."] Jean is already laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [I'm not done.  Listen.  "Where've you  been," said the greasy fellow behind the  desk, "fifty francs won't get you a close  look these days."] Zoey glances at all of the people.  Then her eyes lock wi the concierge security guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ["Listen buddy," said the ex-convict,  pulling him out of his chair by the shirt  collar, "I wanna eat some pussy, and I  want it now!"] The concierge security guard lifts his pant leg slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ["Okay, okay," gasped the proprietor,  "I'll see what I can do."  So the ex-con  followed him through to the very back of  the warehouse through some stained,  tattered red curtains, and into a grimy  little room where a bedraggled looking  whore lay spreadeagled on a filthy bed.   "She's yours for fifty francs," said the  proprietor, and the fellow went at it.] Zoey notices that on the concierge security guard's leg i ankle holster with a small .38 pistol on it.  His fingers begin to unsnap the safety harness on it. Her eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [After a little while, he came across a  piece of egg.  "That's funny," he thought  to himself, "I don't think I had egg for  breakfast."  But he spat it out and kept  eating away.  Next he found a piece of  chipped beef wedged between his front  teeth.  "I'm sure I haven't eaten chipped  beef this week," he thought, but kept on.   Then he came across the corn.  "What is  this?" he said, "I think I'm going to be  sick."] The concierge security guard unsnaps the safety.  Zoey kn he's going to make his move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ["Ya know," says the whore, "that's what  the last guy said."] Before they can even laugh the concierge security guard w out the .38 and fires three shots. Two of them hit Ricardo in the chest.  He falls to the  ground. The other hits Francois in the arm. In an instant Jean is firing his machine gun into the gro of people huddled on the floor. Everyone is screaming and trying to get away. Machine gun fire cuts through the concierge security guar killing him dead. Unfortunately, the wild spray of bullets also rips into t of the tellers, four of the customers, and the loan offic killing them all. People are trying to flee but Claude fires his gun into t ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [No one fucking moves!] Jean has jumped up on the table and is aiming at the peop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Shit!  What happened!?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zed looks up hearing the commotion. Eric comes running out of the bathroom and into the  storage/elevator area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?  What's going on? Zed gets up to go upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  You stay here. Eric runs upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francois is on the ground holding his arm.  He keeps roll back and forth in pain. Ricardo is dead. Jean, Claude, and Oliver are waving their guns around rea to kill someone any second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Nobody fucking moves!  Nobody fucking  moves!] Claude motions to the dead security guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [The gun!  Somebody get it!] Oliver goes over to the dead security guard, the whole ti waving his gun at people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Don't fuck with me!  Don't fuck with  me!] He grabs the gun from the dead security guards limp grip. Eric storms in.  He isn't wearing his mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [What the fuck is going on!?] Zoey notices Eric, she remembers him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing at the dead man)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [This crazy fuck shot Ricardo!] Eric looks over at Ricardo and then at the carnage. Then everybody notices he isn't wearing a mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Eric, your mask.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit. Then Oliver yanks his off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who gives a damn if they see us or not  anyway!  I can't see a fucking think in  this! Everyone takes their masks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Is this what happens?  Is this what  happens when I walk away for five  minutes?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [He had a hidden gun.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mimicking a little child)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [He had a hidden gun.] (then back to normal)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [I don't care!] Then, one of the bank customers, a MALE TOURIST, speaks u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding up his passport)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is insane!  I am a U.S. citizen!   You must let me go! Eric looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm an American!  American!  I'm just  here exchanging dollars.  If it wasn't  for my country you'd all be speaking  German! Eric is tired of this outburst, he shoots him. Everyone screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the people)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [I have had enough of this nonsense!  The  next person that speaks will die!] Everyone is quiet. Francois is sitting on the floor bleeding from his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Eric, I'm sorry.  Things got out of  hand.  But we're in control now.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Good.  Let's try to keep it that way.   God what a mess.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [What the fuck is it now!?  You want me  to hold your hand as you take a piss?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [I have a question.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [What?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Do we know if the alarm went off or  not?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Yes.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [We do?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Yes.  It didn't go off.  If it had the  police would be here and our whole plan  would be fucked.  But they're not here,  and our plan isn't fucked.  So if there  aren't any more fucking stupid questions  I'll go downstairs and see if we're in  yet.  Is that okay with you?] Claude nods. Then, the phone rings. Everyone looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [I thought the phones were dead.] It rings again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phones are dead. Eric grabs a WOMAN TELLER who is crying hysterically and  lifts her to her feet. He drags her to the ringing phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Answer it!] She is crying too hard. Eric puts his gun to her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Answer it or you will die.] She slowly picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (answering phone through tears)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banque Internationale de Paris. She pauses, then hands the phone to Eric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [It's for you.] Eric takes the phone and pushes her to the floor. He puts the receiver to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Hello.] (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Who is this?] Eric motions to Oliver to check the windows. Oliver runs over and peeks out the blinds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God!  The police!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [What do you want?] Eric looks around at the dead bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [We're all fine in here.] Oliver is pacing back and forth wildly.  He starts loadin extra ammo into his weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [No.  I'll tell you what, you go fuck  yourself you fucking pig.  You send  anyone near this building and I'll kill  the first person I lay my hands on.  I've  got plenty hostages here to kill so don't  even think of coming in.] (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Just stay put.  We'll call you when  we're ready.  In the mean time, have a  nice day.] Eric hangs up the phone, and then leaves it off the hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [The silent alarm must have gone off  after all!]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Shut the fuck up!  The alarm didn't do  shit.  For all we know your idiot  shooting brought them here.  Anyhow it  doesn't matter.  Nothing has changed.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [My God!  The police!  What are we going  to do?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Nothing.  We don't have to do anything.   The plan stays the same, just slightly  different.] Then Eric catches sight of Zoey, their eyes lock.  Eric  smiles and winks.  Then he turns to Jean with a whisper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [If the police decide to come in...kill  them.  And if you don't mind, stack those  bodies somewhere else.  This place is a  fucking mess and it's bad for morale.] Then he takes off downstairs, smiling.  Jean is a little  stumped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Eric walks down the stairs and through the reserve vau area a look of intense concentration washes over his face You can see that a trillion calculations are being made i his brain...the question is:  are there any answers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zed is drilling now with a hand drill.  He removes it and blows into the hole.  Shavings come out. Eric comes trotting into the antechamber whistling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to Eric)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  They were just scaring them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, did you tell them to stay quiet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  They're assholes.  Just having fun. Zed looks into the hole. He has drilled into the vault door, revealing some wiring

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucked up my drill bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.  You can buy another one. Zed takes out a volt meter from his briefcase and inserts two prongs into the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cross your fingers. Eric does. The volt meter's needle jumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent.  What next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We find the fuse box.  It'll probably be  upstairs. Zed gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.  I'll find it for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I need to see it myself. Zed jumps up and into the storage/elevator area with Eric close behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it would be better if I looked  for you.  I could--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instead of walking upstairs, Zed finds the fuse box right the next room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on.  Here she is. Eric is a bit relieved. Zed opens it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see. He looks through the fuses and then finds the one he want

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you throw this fuse switch off and  then back on when I call to you.  Any  other switch may set off the alarm. Eric smirks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I wouldn't want to do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (serious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it. Zed goes back to the vaults.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zed trots back to the Poseidon vault door and quickly gra little gizmo from out of his briefcase.  It is a little h made black box with a series of LED's on it and two wires coming out of one side with alligator clips on the end.   Three other wires are also coming out of it. He slips the alligator clips into the hole and latches th He then tapes one of the wires to the vault itself. The two remaining wires he hooks up to a large twelve vol battery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on sweetie don't fail me now. He looks toward the door leading to the reserve vault are

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling to Eric)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready! Zed turns on his little box, the LED's start flickering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now! The lights go out and then back on. There is a whirring sound from the vault door. The LED's quickly go from red to green. There is a loud, heavy clicking as the vault door unlocks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open seasame. Zed smiles and swings the door open revealing the interio the Poseidon vault. Eric comes running in like a kid on Christmas morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It worked! He and Zed hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God it worked! Zed looks into the Poseidon vault at the passage connecti it to the main vault.  It is covered by a small locked ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can get through that lock in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then do it.  We don't have all day. Zed enters the Poseidon vault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zed goes to the gated passage which isn't much more than window in one upper side of the vault, but it's enough to him into the main vault. Eric is right behind him. Zed takes a twirl at the combination lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dime store brand.  Three minutes max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Then, there's a gunshot.  The bullet comes from the Calib vault through the window and almost hits Zed. Zed falls backwards onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merde! Then there's another gunshot. The bullet ricochets through the vault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! Scrambling on their hands and knees Zed and Eric crawl ou the Poseidon vault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They take cover. Another shot is fired into the vault. Zed and Eric look into the vault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another security guard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I stained my pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. Oliver comes running in with his gun ready for action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?!  I came down to see how  things were going and heard shots!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some asshole in the vault. Oliver takes cover and cocks his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got guns.  Why don't we just storm  in and blast his fucking ass!  It's three  against one!  Let's give it the old--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just trying to be helpful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just let me think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to snap at me. Eric peeks into the vault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling into the vault)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Hey you.  Nice shooting.  Play time's  over.  Why don't you throw out your gun?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling from main vault)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Oliver and Eric look at each other and smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Come on.  We don't want to kill you.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [You'll have to!]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly to Zed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this guys problem? (then to the guard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Come on!  You're making me impatient.  I  don't have all day.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Look, don't take it personally.  This is  my job.] Oliver and Eric look at each other and shrug.  Then Eric something in Zed's briefcase.  It looks like grey clay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Then take a paid vacation.  We won't  tell if you won't.] There is a pause.  During this time Eric takes the clay a pushes a detonator into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the Hell are you doing?  Have you  gone mad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Sorry.  I can't.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Well, look, we're going to give you  fifteen minutes to change your mind.   Okay?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Okay.] Zed starts to grab the plastique away from Eric.  Eric  resists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding his voice down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's too much.  It's dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like danger. (then to the guard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Changed your mind yet?] Eric creeps into the room and activates the detonator. Zed and Oliver run for cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [No.  And I'm not going to.  Why don't  you just take the money from the other  vaults?--] Eric tosses the bar of plastique through the caged window makes a break for it. There is a huge explosion in the adjoining main vault.  T walls quake and a fireball bellows out of the caged windo blowing it open. The vault guard #1 screams and then goes silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francois, Claude, and Jean are forcing customers to drag bodies into a cube.  The room shakes and everyone looks  toward the hall that leads to the stairs. The hostages, whose nerves are already shot, start crying

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Should we see if they're okay?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [No.  They're just blasting the vault  open.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [What does it matter now?  We're fucking  surrounded by police.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dust has blown out of the vault and is settling on Oliver Zed, and Eric, who is laughing like a madman. Zed is looking at him like he's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You asshole!  You could have killed us  all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I didn't!  Let's go check out the  damage. Eric gets up and walks into the Poseidon vault. Before Zed follows him he looks at Oliver who doesn't kno what to think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eric laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zed look! He points to the caged window.  It's been blown off it's  hinges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beat you!  I opened it in under three  minutes. He starts laughing and then crawls through the connecting passage into the Caliber vault. Zed, with his briefcase, follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Oliver)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go around and wait at the main vault  door.  When I tell you, open it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  When you tell me, I'll open it  up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Zed crawls through the opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be at the other vault waiting for  you to call to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The main vault looks like what a vault would look like if were blown up from the inside.  On the floor is the still smoldering body of the security guard.  The room is  incredibly smokey. Zed squeezes through the opening. Then, Eric, grinning like a schoolboy, emerges from the s with a brick sized bar of pure gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at it!  We're all rich! The smoke clears and we see that on the far side of the v there is a huge platen on wheels with bricks of gold stac onto it. Eric starts laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're rich! Zed looks at him like he's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're rich!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not out of here yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes but we're rich! Zed takes a seat at the vault door.  The backside of a va door looks like an incredibly intricate clock.  Zed remov the Plexiglass shielding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to show the others. He squirms out of the entry with the brick of gold. Zed shakes his head and goes to work setting dials and us his voltmeter to test electrical points.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claude is talking to Jean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [What?  You think we may actually get out  of this?  You're fooling yourself.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Why are you such a pessimist?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Are you kidding me?  Look at this mess.] Jean surveys the mess, the crying people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [This is nothing.  Imagine the police  outside.  We're dead men.] Eric walks in from the rear stairs.  In his hand is a bri of gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Jean, Francois, Claude...look at this.] They see the gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [You did it!  You got in!]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Zed is opening the vault now.  This is a  taste.] Eric holds the bar of gold up for all the people to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Look at this and tell me I'm not  brilliant.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [You're a monster!  And you'll never  leave this place alive!] Eric shoots her with his Uzi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the hostages)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [None of you are worth half of this  single bar.  Remember that.] Francois, Jean, and Claude look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Eric...can I speak with you?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Of course.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [In private.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [There's no need.  I have nothing to  hide.  What is it Claude?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Well...we're surrounded by the police  and we have no way out.  What are we  going to do?] Eric slaps him across the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [What are you doing Claude?  Talking of  all this false doubt.  What do you think  we're going to do?] Claude is hurt, not physically but emotionally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [I don't know...not the original plan.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Obviously, since Ricardo fucked us up  and didn't kill the concierge fast  enough.  And killing all these assholes--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (motioning to all the  customers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [--isn't going to do us a damn bit of  good now, is it?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [No.  Because we'll need them as hostages  when we get on the plane.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [We're going on a plane?] Eric pats his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Claude, you are a mental giant.  Leave  the plans up to me and just kill people  if they get out of line, okay?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Okay.] Eric turns and starts to walk toward the downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is not Zoe.  Not any more. He looks forward at the streets of Paris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get well.  Then I'll show you the  real Paris. They drive away.
